course_description:
Introduces examples where machine learning (ML) algorithms complement traditional statistical methods for a causal analysis in social science. Teaches the use-cases where ML algorithms complement existing statistical methods and how to combine
methodologies to better answer data-driven questions.
prerequisites: (QTM 220 or ECON 320) and (QTM 110 or QTM_OX 110) and (QTM 150 or QTM_OX 150) and (QTM 210 or QTM_OX 210 or ECON 220 or ECON_OX 220 or MATH 361) and (MATH 210 or MATH_OX 210 or MATH 211 or MATH_OX 211) and (MATH 211 or MATH_OX 211) or transfer credit.
schedule_location: MW 4pm-5:15pm in New Psyc Bldg 225 (36 Eagle Ro
